SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Address Picklists: Easily Specify a Single Country or State Value

To allow only one country, territory, or state in address picklists on your storefront, you can now easily specify the single value allowed. You can create page labels that B2B Commerce for Visualforce references when showing the country, territory, or state. If you localize your storefront, create localized page label records to easily provide translated country, territory, or state names.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce provided configuration settings for populating country, state, or territory picklists. However, changing these settings to TRUE always set the default country to the United States and the default state to Alabama.

How: After you upgrade the global data, create page label records with the following names. In the ValueRT field of each page label record, enter your country, state, or territory values.

PAGE LABEL NAME	VALUERT EXAMPLE
CountryList_Value	US
CountryList_Label	United States
StateList_Value	IA
StateList_Label	Iowa

To use these page labels on your storefront, change the following configuration settings under the Field Display module to TRUE:

Skip getCountries
Skip getStates

If these settings remain FALSE, B2B Commerce for Visualforce populates the available countries or territories and states from the values that you specify in your storefront settings.

SEE ALSO
Allow Only One Country, Territory, or State in Address Picklists

title: Configure Single Country or State Value in B2B Commerce
